thread.title: 'Star Wars' tickets are already on sale — if you can get them
thread.title_full: 'Star Wars' tickets are already on sale — if you can get them

title: 'Star Wars' tickets are already on sale — if you can get them
text:
'Star Wars' tickets are already on sale — if you can get them Fans are chomping at the bit to see 'The Force Awakens,' which isn't out until Dec. 18. Post to Facebook 'Star Wars' tickets are already on sale — if you can get them Fans are chomping at the bit to see 'The Force Awakens,' which isn't out until Dec. 18. Check out this story on USATODAY.com: http://usat.ly/1LHnEds Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs 'Star Wars' tickets are already on sale — if you can get them Brian Truitt , USA TODAY 9:36 p.m. EDT October 19, 2015 Fans blitzed movie-ticket sites Monday night to get tickets for "Star Wars: The Force Awakens." (Photo: David James) 1 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
The Force may be awakening, but movie ticket websites are crashing. 
Star Wars: The Force Awakens isn't in theaters until the evening of Dec. 17, but fans quickly nabbed seats for the first shows, which went on sale just before 8 p.m. ET Monday. They were originally announced to be available just after the trailer launch at halftime of ESPN's Monday Night Football . 
There was so much interest that sites such as Fandango.com, AMCTheatres.com, MovieTickets.com and others slowed to a crawl, if they worked at all. Arclight and Fandango right now pic.twitter.com/hquLpAmmwf — Eric Goldman (@TheEricGoldman) October 20, 2015 
Not surprisingly, folks took to social media to complain about this disturbance in the Force. Got my @Drafthouse tickets for a "Star Wars" sequel called "Database Error Occurred." Sounds dark. — Omar L. Gallaga (@omarg) October 20, 2015 The internet, when I try to get Star Wars tickets, and the horrifying result of not being able to see it. pic.twitter.com/9oV9heQCUU — Russ Fischer (@russfischer) October 20, 2015 Trying to buy Star Wars tickets like pic.twitter.com/q7woWTyhBw 1 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://usat.ly/1LHnEds TOP VIDEOS
